abstrac: Writing from the heart, mind and soul.
bio:
I am a creator of (published) children's fiction and character 'voices' aimed at relieving the stresses and illnesses of childhood. (Nomoni series)
I am English born and bred and believe in the good, clear and grammatically correct writing taught in my schooldays.
I have a Diploma in Religious Studies from Cambridge University and am a qualified/experienced Bible teacher.
I also hold a TESOL/TEFL English language teaching certificate and am able to plan courses or provide single/multiple conversation lessons for all ages and abilities.
Also - I have owned and bred champion Saluki hounds for nearly 40 years, published many articles and a website on them with the focus on health and welfare of sighthounds and dogs in general. (www.shuhban.com)
Home Base is Cyprus but I am currently studying the language and culture of Tuscany, Italy. Aside from this, I am retirement age with plenty of free time and energy to dedicate to any writing project.
Flexible on hours and fees. E-mail always the preferred means of communication.

abstrac: Designing solutions for a better tomorrow
bio:
I am a creative and innovative designer with 1 year of experience in the industry. With a keen eye for detail and a passion for delivering exceptional design work, I have built a reputation as a skilled professional who consistently exceeds client expectations.

I have a deep understanding of design principles, as well as a strong grasp of the latest design tools and technologies, which enables me to create designs that are not only visually appealing but also functional and effective.

An expert in combining beautiful design with user-centered functionality to create intuitive and engaging products.

Here are some work terms that may apply to a designer:

Illustration for book

Design brief: A document outlining the scope and objectives of a design project.

Wireframe: A visual guide that represents the layout of a design and the relationship between different elements.

Moodboard: A collage of images, colors, and textures used to convey the overall feel or tone of a design.

Iteration: The process of refining and improving a design through multiple rounds of feedback and revision.

Vector: A digital image format that allows for infinite scaling without loss of quality.

Typography: The art and technique of arranging type to make written language legible, readable, and appealing.

Mockup: A realistic representation of a design concept, often used for presentation purposes.

Brand identity: The visual and messaging elements that define a brand and create a cohesive look and feel across all marketing materials.

User experience (UX): The overall experience that a user has when interacting with a product or service, including usability, functionality, and satisfaction.

User interface (UI): The visual and interactive elements of a digital product or service, such as buttons, menus, and icons, that allow users to interact with the system.
